estimate 0.1.0
  • Reference

estimate

estimate is a lightweight package helping with model-based estimations, used in the computation of marginal means, contrast analysis, predictions and such.

Installation

Run the following:

install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("easystats/estimate")
library("estimate")

Documentation

The package documentation can be found here.

Features

The package is built around 7 main functions:

  • estimate_means(): Estimates the average values at each factor levels
  • estimate_contrasts(): Estimates and tests contrasts between different factor levels
  • estimate_slopes(): Estimates the slopes of numeric predictors at different factor levels
  • estimate_response(): Predict the response variable based on the model
  • estimate_fit(): Estimates the link between variables of the model and the response
  • estimate_smooth(): Describes a non-linear term (e.g. in GAMs) by its linear parts
  • data_grid(): Creates a reference grid of provided data or model

Examples

Estimate marginal means

library(rstanarm)

model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ Species, data=iris)

estimate_means(model)
Species Median MAD CI_low CI_high
setosa 3.42 0.05 3.34 3.50
versicolor 2.77 0.05 2.69 2.85
virginica 2.97 0.05 2.90 3.06

Contrast analysis

estimate_contrasts(model)
Level1 Level2 Median MAD CI_low CI_high pd ROPE_Percentage ROPE_Equivalence
setosa versicolor 0.65 0.07 0.54 0.77 100.00 0.00 rejected
setosa virginica 0.45 0.07 0.34 0.57 100.00 0.00 rejected
versicolor virginica -0.20 0.07 -0.31 -0.09 99.78 6.35 undecided

check the contrasts at different points of another linear predictor

model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ Species * Petal.Length, data=iris)

estimate_contrasts(model, modulate="Petal.Length", length=3)
Level1 Level2 Petal.Length Median MAD CI_low CI_high pd ROPE_Percentage ROPE_Equivalence
setosa versicolor 1.00 1.54 0.31 1.01 2.03 100.00 0.00 rejected
setosa virginica 1.00 1.22 0.34 0.66 1.80 100.00 0.05 rejected
versicolor virginica 1.00 -0.32 0.45 -1.03 0.46 75.35 14.22 undecided
setosa versicolor 3.95 1.79 0.48 1.06 2.57 100.00 0.00 rejected
setosa virginica 3.95 1.82 0.51 1.05 2.66 100.00 0.00 rejected
versicolor virginica 3.95 0.03 0.14 -0.21 0.25 59.52 51.95 undecided
setosa versicolor 6.90 2.05 1.02 0.37 3.60 98.52 0.98 rejected
setosa virginica 6.90 2.44 1.00 0.97 4.16 99.60 0.32 rejected
versicolor virginica 6.90 0.39 0.28 -0.05 0.83 91.57 11.65 undecided

Find a predictor’s slopes at each factor level

estimate_slopes(model)
Species Median MAD CI_low CI_high pd ROPE_Percentage ROPE_Equivalence
setosa 0.42 0.19 0.15 0.74 99.17 3.35 undecided
versicolor 0.33 0.09 0.17 0.48 100.00 0.68 rejected
virginica 0.21 0.07 0.08 0.33 99.72 7.92 undecided

Generate predictions from your model to compare it with original data

estimate_response(model)
Species Petal.Length Median MAD CI_low CI_high
setosa 1.4 3.40 0.31 2.90 3.95
setosa 1.4 3.41 0.33 2.88 3.95
setosa 1.3 3.34 0.33 2.84 3.91
setosa 1.5 3.44 0.31 2.96 3.99
setosa 1.4 3.39 0.33 2.85 3.93
setosa 1.7 3.52 0.33 3.01 4.06

Estimate the link between the response and a predictor

model <- stan_glm(Sepal.Width ~ poly(Petal.Length, 2), data=iris)

estimate_fit(model)
Petal.Length Median MAD CI_low CI_high
1.00 3.62 0.07 3.52 3.74
1.98 3.18 0.04 3.11 3.25
2.97 2.90 0.05 2.82 2.97
3.95 2.78 0.05 2.71 2.86
4.93 2.83 0.04 2.77 2.90
5.92 3.05 0.05 2.96 3.15
6.90 3.44 0.12 3.24 3.64

Describe the smooth term

estimate_smooth(model)
Part Start End Size Trend Linearity Smoothness
1 1.000000 4.113065 0.53 -0.0080010 0.9380289 0.9989676
2 4.113065 6.900000 0.47 0.0068773 0.9342941 0.9989684
